TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DeviceFilterElement extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Represents a device-specific filter to be applied to the application. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class corresponds to the `<filter>` element for the `<deviceFilters>` section of the ASP.NET settings schema.
A filter can be either a comparison filter or an evaluator filter. Comparison-based filters compare a value specified by the developer to the current value of a device capability at run time. The evaluator (or delegate-based) filter uses a method from a programmer-specified class to perform the evaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: public DeviceFilterElement (string name, string compareName, string argument);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string compareName, string argument) cil managed

Docs.param: The name by which the evaluator will be identified.
The capability evaluated by the comparison evaluator.
The argument against which the capability should be compared.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class as a comparison filter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is used to create a comparison filter.

MemberSignature.Value: public DeviceFilterElement (string name, Type filterClass, string method);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.Type filterClass, string method) cil managed

Docs.param: The name by which the evaluator will be identified.
The class type that contains the evaluator delegate.
The method in filterClass that is the evaluator delegate.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class as an evaluator filter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the constructor for the evaluator (or delegate-based) filter.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the argument against which the capability should be compared. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The argument against which the capability should be compared.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in comparison filters.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the capability evaluated by the comparison evaluator. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The capability evaluated by the comparison evaluator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in comparison filters.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the class type that contains the evaluator delegate. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The class type that contains the evaluator delegate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in evaluator (or delegate-based) filters.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the method in the class specified by the property that is used as the evaluator delegate. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The method in that is the evaluator delegate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used in evaluator (or delegate-based) filters.

Docs.summary: Gets the name by which the evaluator will be identified. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The name by which the evaluator will be identified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is required for both comparison and evaluator filters.
